column3: GREYBOX Scheduling:  Designing a Joint Cognitive System  for Sustainable Manufacturing
column166: The aims of this work were to investigate how decision making in production planning happens, to understand how energy efficiency could be included as a manufacturing goal and to design a decision support system that integrates into current work practices. This case study describes the research, design and development this system. An interactive visualisation provides an interface to a flexible optimisation engine and allows experts to interpret, amend and augment system inputs and outputs without the need for programming knowledge. This approach supports collaboration between automated and human agents, working as a joint cognitive system.
column167: 1. United Nations, Environment Programme (2011) Towards a Green Economy. \ 2. Christoffersen, K. and Woods, D. (2002) How to make automated systems team players. Advances in Human Performance and Cog. Eng. Research, 2:1 12, \ 3. http://www.kap-project.eu (accessed 24/08/2013) \ 4. Vicente, K. J., (1999) Cognitive Work Analysis: Toward Safe, Productive, and Healthy Computer-Based Work. Erlbaum and Associates, Mahwah, NJ, \ 5. Hollnagel, E. and Woods, D. D., (2005) Joint cognitive systems: Foundations of cognitive systems engineering. Taylor and Francis, Boca Raton, FL, \ 6. Crandall, B., Klein, G. and Hoffman, R. (2006). Working Minds: A Practitioner’s Guide to Cognitive Task Analysis (Bradford Books). The MIT Press, 1 edn. \ 7. Potter, S., Woods, D. D., Roth, E. M., Fowlkes, J., & Hoffman, R. R. (2006, October). Evaluating the effectiveness of a joint cognitive system In Proc. of the Human Factors and Ergonomics Society (Vol. 50, No. 3, pp. 314-318). SAGE Publications. \ 8. Brooke, J. (1996). SUS: a "quick and dirty" usability scale. In P. W. Jordan et al. Usability Evaluation in Industry. London: Taylor and Francis \
column168: Joint Cognitive Systems; Decision Support; Visualisation; Optimisation; Design
column174: The GREYBOX scheduling solution supports a joint cognitive system for energy efficient production planning
column175: "Zip file containing a PDF of the Presentation"
column176: This presentation describes the research, design and development of a software tool for energy efficient scheduling in an industrial environment. The system couples an optimization engine with an interactive visualization.
